image.altText: Branches on the road after storms tore them down.

props.synopsis: A major clean up effort is underway across the ACT and surrounds after a severe thunderstorm on Wednesday night pulled down trees, flooded homes and cut power to hundreds of properties.Â

title.children: Hail 'as big as golf balls' and thunder strikes Canberra with 110kph wind gusts

image.altText: A man wearing a yellow high-vis vest over a black suit and tie stands in front of a blue bus speaking into two microphones.

props.synopsis: The ACT government insists most of its electric bus fleet is working as expected despite Transport Canberra having to send several vehicles back to their Sydney-based manufacturer due to technical issues.

title.children: Four electric buses pulled from Canberra roads after just months in service

image.altText: Empty desks on the CommSec trading floor, including social distancing signs

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission found the man, who believed Microsoft Teams amounted to "illegal video surveillance", had not been bullied at work.

title.children: Lawyer who claimed Microsoft Teams was 'illegal video surveillance' has bullying claim rejected

image.altText: a mum with long brown hair and glasses kisses a six month old baby

props.synopsis: Many new mums turn to social media for the support of a community. But a group of Canberra mums recently found out their local group wasn't as local as they thought.

title.children: New mums turned to a Facebook group for support, but things weren't as they thought

image.altText: A yellow 'road closed' sign across a road with clothing and other items scattered in the background.

props.synopsis: A motorist who allegedly hit and killed a pedestrian in Jerrabomberra late last year has been charged with causing death by dangerous and negligent driving.

title.children: Woman charged over fatal Jerrabomberra crash that killed mother-of-two

image.altText: police car on country road

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man who allegedly shot at four friends up to nine times in the space of 10 minutes at a farm near Canberra after they got into a verbal disagreement is granted bail.

title.children: Man accused of shooting rifle at friends near Uriarra Village granted bail

image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: Transport Canberra's new ticketing system was intended to make paying for and planning routes on public transport easier, but almost two months since its rollout some commuters are still struggling to navigate MyWay+.

title.children: 'Still not ready': Commuters struggling to navigate MyWay+

image.altText: A man in a suit looking on

props.synopsis: Gazans celebrated in the streets after news Hamas and Israel had signed a ceasefire agreement broke. But fresh attacks from the IDF have left some people in the besieged territory wondering if they'll survive until Sunday. Follow live.

title.children: Right-wing Israeli protesters block roads in protest against Gaza ceasefire deal

image.altText: picture of Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu

props.synopsis: Deep divisions within Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government threaten to scuttle the freshly minted ceasefire and hostage deal with Hamas, even before it has come into force.Â

title.children: Politics is a numbers game, and Netanyahu is playing it with ceasefire

image.altText: A graphic with a yellow background showing people waiting on chairs with a big clock in the centre of the image

props.synopsis: The amount of time Australians are waiting in hospital emergency departments is increasing with the wait time for admission now between 12 and 16 hours for 90 per cent of patients, according to a new report.

title.children: Emergency wait times blow out as hospitals struggle to discharge patients

image.altText: A close up image of Kevin Rudd with his hand on his chin.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese confirms his ambassador to the United States, Kevin Rudd, has made direct contact with US president-elect Donald Trump, saying he is confident Mr Rudd can succeed under the Trump administration.

title.children: Kevin Rudd and Donald Trump have made direct contact, PM confirms

image.altText: Silver Mercedes Benz vandalised with an antisemitic message in the early hours of the morning

props.synopsis: Multiple cars were set alight and at least one painted with offensive slurs in Dover Heights in Sydney's eastern suburbs.Â

title.children: Home vandalised in anti-Semitic attack used to belong to Jewish leader

image.altText: a stop sign at the level crossing

props.synopsis: More than 18,000 level crossings in Australia have little more than a stop sign to warn drivers to look out for freight trains hurtling towards them in the dark. A campaign is calling for a mandatory lighting solution.

title.children: 'It wouldn't pass the pub test': Behind the push to put mandatory lighting on trains

image.altText: Gavin Newsom dressed in a hat, sunglasses and a jacket walks on a road. A plume of smoke extends over the sky in the background.

props.synopsis: As blazes continue to ravage parts of California, the heir apparent of the Democratic Party has found himself at the centre of a political firestorm stoked by rival Republicans and Donald Trump.Â

title.children: 'He is the boss': For all the alleged failures across LA, one man was in charge

image.altText: SpaceX Starship on launch pad

props.synopsis: SpaceX is preparing to rocket launch that, if it goes ahead, will put an end to a spate of Qantas flight delays. Here's how.Â

title.children: SpaceX prototype fails in space after launch caused string of Qantas delays

image.altText: David Lynch appearing on the runway of the Cannes Film Festival.

props.synopsis: The acclaimed filmmaker, who directed Blue Velvet, The Elephant Man and Mulholland Drive, dies aged 78.

title.children: 'A singular genius': Peers pay tribute to filmmaker David Lynch

image.altText: DonaldÂ TrumpÂ is sworn in as the 45th president of the United States

props.synopsis: Donald Trump won the US presidential election in November last year, but he's not officially the president yet. Here's what to expect from his inauguration.Â

title.children: Who's on the guest list for Trump's inauguration?

image.altText: man wearing green and gold singlet and hat shouting at the tennis

props.synopsis: Melbourne's beloved coffee is called into question, while Daniil Medvedev is knocked out in a major upset. Here are the five quick hits from day five of the Australian Open.

title.children: Five quick hits: 3am ending, crowds under fire and Vic coffee roasted

image.altText: A drone shot of a suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: The ASX slips slightly after falls on Wall Street overnight. A survey by UBS reveals the reach of the 'bank of mum and dad', with 40 per cent of respondents giving or receiving cash last year. Follow live.

title.children: Survey reveals how much parents give their children for property

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX virtually flat during early trade
Morningstar analysts back merger of Myer and Premier fashion brands
Glencore declines comment on the Rio Tinto merger rumours

image.altText: People work at desks in an airy room, sitting in front of computers.

props.synopsis: A recent WA court ruling sets the bar for how far businesses need to go to protect themselves against cyber criminals, according to experts, but the good news is it isn't hard to meet.Â

title.children: Expert reveals antidote for invoice scams after WA court ruling

image.altText: Young woman selfie in the Australian bush

props.synopsis: Alexandra Paton, who researches how to manage feral cat populations, says her PhD is important for Australia's wildlife but her income is lower than what she earned as a teenager at Macca's.Â

title.children: Alex loves doing her PhD, but says she's earning under the minimum wage

image.altText: Marles navy pointing

props.synopsis: A new budgetary report said it would be 'difficult and expensive' to sell Virginia class submarines to Australia without compromising the US Navy.

title.children: US congressional analysis blunt on AUKUS difficulties

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Four men stand side by side smiling on front of a green door

props.synopsis: With new frontman Frank Carter, the band will play their iconic debut album Never Mind The Bollocks in full across Australia this April.

title.children: For the first time in decades, punk legends Sex Pistols will tour Australia

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds

props.synopsis: The actor and director had already launched a lawsuit against New York Times, claiming the paper worked with Lively to destroy his reputation.Â

title.children: Justin Baldoni sues It Ends With Us co-star Blake Lively

image.altText: A man in a blue suit and white open necked shirt sits in a restaurant smiling

props.synopsis: Robert Pether's family fear he will die in jail, as he is about to be hit with money laundering charges.

title.children: Australian stuck in Iraqi jail faces another 10 years inside as health worsens

image.altText: People coming off a train

props.synopsis: A ruling by the Fair Work Commission will see the industrial action delaying Sydney's train services temporarily paused. But is the end of the story?

title.children: What the Fair Work Commission's decision means for Sydney's train network

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: Have you been paying attention to the news this week? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The LA fires, Nick Kyrgios and two new baby giraffes

image.altText: Tourists flocking at a train station in Japan

props.synopsis: Nearly 1 million Australians visited Japan last year, up more than 300,000 from 2023.

title.children: Australians are loving Japan so much they're calling it the 'new Bali'

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence

props.synopsis: As prisoner numbers in the Northern Territory continue to climb, room in the prisons is running out. A facility dedicated to some of the most vulnerable inmates is now being used to house general population prisoners.

title.children: Calls for âurgent reviewâ of treatment of NT's mentally ill prisoners

image.altText: Woman smiling for photo

props.synopsis: "You are exactly like your mother." That's one of the distressing letters Romany Wake says she's received from her jailed father, as she urges prison services to do better to stop the communication.

title.children: Rachel Wake's jailed killer able to send dozens of distressing letters to daughter

image.altText: A storm cloud over a busy beach.

props.synopsis: Storm clean-up efforts are underway in Queensland as a heatwave persists over the north, but conditions should ease this weekend.Â

title.children: Hundreds without power after more damaging Queensland storms

image.altText: Lightning flashing across the night sky

props.synopsis: Residents in regional NSW have been warned to brace for more wild weather as an intense storm cell sweeps across the state, bringing more strong wind, heavy rain and hail stones.

title.children: NSW expected to be battered by more storms, weather bureau warns

image.altText: A man looking at the night sky through binoculars

props.synopsis: The night sky is putting on a celestial show with a dazzling "planetary parade" featuring six major planets and a bonus comet.Â

title.children: Six planets and a bonus comet set to light up the night sky this weekend. Here's how to spot them

image.altText: A fire is seen in the grandstand of the DJ area at the cricket ground, with one person trying to extinguish it

props.synopsis: An electrical fire at the Gabba has forced play in the Big Bash game between the Brisbane Heat and Hobart Hurricanes to be temporarily stopped.

title.children: Fire breaks out in stands during Big Bash game, causing halt in play
